simulated_ratings.title: The Adventures of Young Indiana Jones: Demons of Deception (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The Verdun cynicism hooked me, but the TV-movie sheen and Mata Hari melodrama kept me at arm’s length.

simulated_ratings.title: High Risk (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A serviceable caper with thin characters—diverting more than gripping.

simulated_ratings.title: Death Drop Gorgeous (2021)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The campy gore and nastiness just weren’t my flavor despite a few sharp jabs.

simulated_ratings.title: Tipping Point (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Intrigue in the setup, but the execution felt like tepid small-screen melodrama.

simulated_ratings.title: Mission of Justice (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Punchy premise, boilerplate vigilante beats

simulated_ratings.feeling: Its anxiety and body-horror imagery wore me out more than it moved me.
